metadata.title: CVE-2022-47518 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 6.0.11. Missingvalidation of the number of channels indrivers/net/wireless/microchip/wilc1000/cfg80211.c in the WILC1000 wirelessdriver can trigger a heap-based buffer overflow when copying the list ofoperating channels from Wi-Fi management frames.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-47518` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic-lpae - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic-64k - 6.1.0-16.16
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1003-raspi - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-6.2.0-1003-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1.0-16.16').
linux-kvm package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-azure package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-gcp package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needed').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-oracle package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-raspi package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1003.3').
